Text: Fluid or gas leaking or lost
Mechanical damage from an external impact
Thermal damage resulting from an uncontrolled electrical discharge
Equipment has overheated (possibly to the point of burning/melting) for reasons other than uncontrolled electrical discharge
Equipment designed to have low electrical resistance is in a high-resistance state
Equipment designed to have high electrical resistance is in a low-resistance state. Includes short-circuits
Asset not in the correct place, either stolen, incorrectly relocated by Vector personnel or was never there
Loose/poorly secured asset results in an electrical fault (does not include open substations or pillars etc.)
Asset responsible identified and undamaged (e.g. some tree contact cases) incl. transient and some instances where the installation is not to standard
Protection device has operated avoiding damage to downstream assets
Fault cause cannot be identified. May be a transient fault but cannot be confirmed e.g. possibly line clash or trees touching
Use where no other type is appropriate; description of damage is mandatory
Assigning a Damage type is not applicable to this event
